results.title: [Relationship between sympathetic activity and response to treatment with atenolol in hypertensive patients. Investigation group of the study of efficiency and tolerance of atenolol in hypertensive patients with increase in the sympathetic activity].
results.text_hl: CONCLUSION: Baseline @DISEASE_Tachycardia @DISEASE_MESH:D013610 @@@tachycardia@@@ or symptoms suggesting @DISEASE_Anxiety @DISEASE_MESH:D001007 @@@anxiety@@@, @DISEASE_Tension_Type_Headache @DISEASE_MESH:D018781 @@@emotional tension@@@ or @<m>DISEASE_Urinary_Bladder_Overactive</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D053201 @@@sympathetic overactivity@@@ are associated with a more pronounced blood @DISEASE_Pressure_Ulcer @DISEASE_MESH:D003668 @@@pressure@@@ fall to antihypertensive treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: de la Sierra A. [Relationship between sympathetic activity and response to treatment with atenolol in hypertensive patients. Investigation group of the study of efficiency and tolerance of atenolol in hypertensive patients with increase in the sympathetic activity]. Med Clin (Barc). 1999 Jun 19;113(2):41-5. PMID: 10425617

results.title: Withdrawal phenomena after atenolol and bopindolol: hormonal changes in normal volunteers.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Isoproterenol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007545 @@@Isoprenaline@@@ infusions were given to determine sensitivity of heart rate responses and haemodynamic changes measured in response to physiological manoeuvres. 3. Following @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ withdrawal the results show hormonal evidence of @<m>DISEASE_Urinary_Bladder_Overactive</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D053201 @@@adrenergic overactivity@@@ in the form of elevation of plasma @CHEMICAL_Hydrocortisone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006854 @@@cortisol@@@, @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Glucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005947 @@@glucose@@@ levels.

citations.NLM: Walden RJ, Tomlinson B, Graham B, Smith C, Betteridge DJ, Prichard BN. Withdrawal phenomena after atenolol and bopindolol: hormonal changes in normal volunteers. Br J Clin Pharmacol. 1990 Oct;30(4):547-56. PMID: 1981317
